entity_resolver.core.utils module¶

A collection of utility functions and classes.

This module consists of miscellaneous tools used by various modules. It helps implement these modules’ functionalities in a much cleaner and extensible way. It includes components for timing, logging, computation, and implementation of special data structures.

class entity_resolver.core.utils.ClusteringMetrics[source]¶

Bases: object

A collection of metrics to measure performance of clustering.

This class consists only of class methods.

For detailed algorithms behind each of these clustering metric functions, please refer to Advanced Guide.

_logger[source]¶

Used to log information regarding these clustering metric computations.

Type

Logger

_logger = <Logger Evaluator (WARNING)>[source]
classmethod ami(labels, preds, average_method='max', **kwargs)[source]¶

Compute the adjusted mutual information.

It simply wraps the scikit-learn AMI function.

Parameters

  • labels (Mapping) – Mapping reference ids to cluster ids. The cluster ids may be different from those in the ground truth.

  • preds (OrderedDict) – Mapping reference ids to cluster ids. The dictionary is sorted (key-value pairs are inserted) in ascending order of node id.

  • average_method (str) – Indicate how to compute adjusted mutual information. Valid values are 'min', 'geometric', 'arithmetic', and 'max'.

Return type

float

Returns

The adjusted mutual information value.

See also

AMI explained by scikit-learn.

classmethod precision_recall(labels, preds, log=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Compute the precision, recall, and f1.

Parameters

  • labels (Mapping) – Mapping reference ids to cluster ids. The cluster ids may be different from those in the ground truth.

  • preds (OrderedDict) – Mapping reference ids to cluster ids. The dictionary is sorted (key-value pairs are inserted) in ascending order of node id.

  • log (bool) – Whether to log information when it is called.

Return type

Tuple[float, float, float]

Returns

(precision, recall, f1). This is computed using pairwise measure.

classmethod v_measure(labels, preds, **kwargs)[source]¶

Compute the V-measure score.

It simply wraps the scikit-learn V-measure function.

Parameters

  • labels (Mapping) – Mapping reference ids to cluster ids. The cluster ids may be different from those in the ground truth.

  • preds (OrderedDict) – Mapping reference ids to cluster ids. The dictionary is sorted (key-value pairs are inserted) in ascending order of node id.

Return type

float

Returns

The V-measure score.

See also

V-measure explained by scikit-learn.

class entity_resolver.core.utils.DSU(items)[source]¶

Bases: object

Implement the DSU data structure for hashable objects.

It implements path compression and union by rank to achieve optimal time complexity.

Parameters

items (Iterable[Hashable]) – The list of items to build the DSU data structure from.

items[source]¶

Use the items in the items argument as keys and themselves as values. Created during object instantiation.

Type

Dict[Hashable, Hashable]

rank[source]¶

Store the rank of each disjoint set.

Type

Dict[Hashable, int]

Merge the sets respectively containing the two items into one.

class entity_resolver.core.utils.PriorityQueue(items=[])[source]¶

Bases: object

The priority queue data stucture for SimilarityEntry objects.

Parameters

items (Iterable[SimilarityEntry]) – The list of SimilarityEntry objects to be put in the priority queue.

_queue[source]¶

The inner min heap data structure containing all the SimilarityEntry objects. It copies the input items argument during object instantiation and hence will never modify the original input.

Type

List[SimilarityEntry]

Important

Only use the remove method if the item is guaranteed to exist in the priority queue. Otherwise use the discard method. Failure to do so might result in unexpected behavior.

Note

This class uses a min heap to implement the priority queue.

__len__()[source]¶

Implement the len operator using length of the min heap.

Return type

int

Returns

The length of the priority queue, which is the same as the length of the min heap.

_heapify()[source]¶

Alter the _queue attribute into a min heap in O(n) time.

This method is only used once during object instantiation since the input is not supposed to be a min heap already.

Return type

None

_siftdown(start_pos, pos)[source]¶

Push down the object at the given index to root till a threshold.

Parameters

  • start_pos (int) – The object to be pushed down stops if its index is already less than or equal to this value.

  • pos (int) – The index of the object to be pushed down.

Return type

None

_siftup(pos)[source]¶

Push up the object at the given index in the min heap to leaves.

Parameters

pos (int) – The index of the object to be pushed up.

Return type

None

discard(item)[source]¶

Remove an item from the priority queue if it is in the queue.

Return type

Optional[SimilarityEntry]

Returns

If the input item is in the priority queue, this item is returned. Otherwise return None.

pop()[source]¶

Pop the smallest item from the priority queue and return it.

Return type

SimilarityEntry

Returns

The smallest item in the priority queue.

push(item)[source]¶

Push an item into the priority queue.

Parameters

item (SimilarityEntry) – The item to be added to the priority queue.

Return type

None

remove(item)[source]¶

Remove an item contained in the priority queue from the queue.

Parameters

item (SimilarityEntry) – The item to remove from the priority queue. One must ensure that it is contained in the priority queue. Otherwise use the discard method instead.

Return type

SimilarityEntry

Returns

The removed item.

update(item, new_item)[source]¶

Replace an item in the priority queue with another.

Parameters

  • item (SimilarityEntry) – The item in the priority queue to be replaced. One must ensure that this item is contained in the priority queue.

  • new_item (SimilarityEntry) – The item to replace the original item in the priority queue.

Note

The method does not return anything.

Return type

None

class entity_resolver.core.utils.SimFuncFactory[source]¶

Bases: object

A collection of attribute similarity function producer methods.

This class consists only of class methods and a helper static method.

The purpose of this class is to decouple the main clustering algorithm and the attribute similarity calculation. It is achieved by registering these producer methods in the Resolver object and use a parsing mechansim to preset how the attribute similarity on each attribute is supposed to be computed. The producers instead of similarity functions themselves are registered because certain similarity functions require extra information to be passed and preprocessed before computation of similarities.

For detailed algorithms behind each of these similarity computation, please refer to Advanced Guide.

static _union_intersect_counter(counter1, counter2, accumulator)[source]¶

Helper function to compute union and interset of two multisets.

Parameters

  • counter1 (Counter) – Represents the multiset of cluster ids.

  • counter2 (Counter) – Represents the multiset of cluster ids.

  • accumulator (Callable[[float, int, Hashable], float]) –

    How one should increment the result at each iteration when looping through keys in the two counters. Its inputs are current accumulated result, current counter value (unioned/ intersected), and the current counter key.

    Eg., lambda curr, count, key: curr + count means add the unioned/intersected count at each iteration step. Hence the final result is just the sum of all the union/intersected counts

Note

The initial value for accumulator to accumulate upon is 0.

Return type

Tuple[float, float]

Returns

(union result, intersect result) computed based on the rule specified by the accumulator argument.

classmethod produce_adar_attr(**kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a function to compute customized Adar score.

Return type

Callable[[Collection, Collection, Callable[[Any], float]], float]

Returns

An Adar similarity function with customized ambiguity estimate based on attribute values. Its inputs are two collections of ids of neighboring clusters (of the two clusters one intend to compute similarity on) and a function which outputs the uniqueness of given a cluster id. It returns the similarity score as a float.

classmethod produce_adar_attr_fr(**kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a function to compute customized Adar score using multiset.

Return type

Callable[[Collection, Collection, Callable[[Any], float]], float]

Returns

A Adar similarity function with customized ambiguity estimate based on attribute values which also counts neighbor multiplicities. Its inputs are two collections of ids of neighboring clusters (of the two clusters one intend to compute similarity on) and a function which outputs the uniqueness of given a cluster id. It returns the similarity score as a float.

Return type

Returns

An Adar similarity function. Its inputs are two collections of ids of neighboring clusters (of the two clusters one intend to compute similarity on) and a function which outputs the uniqueness of given a cluster id. It returns the similarity score as a float.

classmethod produce_adar_neighbor_fr(**kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a function to compute Adar similarity using multisets.

Return type

Callable[[Collection, Collection, Callable[[Any], float]], float]

Returns

An Adar similarity function which counts neighbor multiplicities. Its inputs are two collections of ids of neighboring clusters (of the two clusters one intend to compute similarity on) and a function which outputs the uniqueness of given a cluster id. It returns the similarity score as a float.

classmethod produce_jaro(weight, corpus_list, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a function to compute Jaro similarity.

Parameters

  • weight (Union[float, int]) – The weight assigned to a particular reference attribute.

  • corpus_list (Sequence[Sequence[str]]) – A list of tokenized strings (a list of a list of words).

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments. They may override preceding default values.

Return type

Callable[[str, str], float]

Returns

A Jaro similarity function. It accepts two strings as inputs and returns a float as their similarity score wighted by the given weight.

classmethod produce_jaro_winkler(weight, corpus_list, jw_prefix_weight=0.1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a function to compute Jaro-Winkler similarity.

Parameters

  • weight (Union[float, int]) – The weight assigned to a particular reference attribute.

  • corpus_list (Sequence[Sequence[str]]) – A list of tokenized strings (a list of a list of words).

  • jw_prefix_weight (Union[float, int]) – The prefix weight used to calculate Jaro-Winkler similarity. It is used only when second_sim is set to 'jaro_winkler'.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments. They may override preceding default values.

Return type

Callable[[str, str], float]

Returns

A Jaro-Winkler similarity function. It accepts two strings as inputs and returns a float as their similarity score wighted by the given weight.

classmethod produce_stfidf(weight, corpus_list, stfidf_threshold=0.5, second_sim='jaro_winkler', jw_prefix_weight=0.1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return a function to compute soft-tfidf similarity

Parameters

  • weight (Union[float, int]) – The weight assigned to a particular reference attribute.

  • corpus_list (Sequence[Sequence[str]]) – A list of tokenized strings (a list of a list of words).

  • stfidf_threshold (Union[float, int]) – Used to filter words involved in computing tfidf similarity based on secondary similarity function.

  • second_sim (str) – Indicate the secondary similarity function. Valid values are 'jaro_winkler', 'jaro' and 'scaled_lev'.

  • jw_prefix_weight (Union[float, int]) – The prefix weight used to calculate Jaro-Winkler similarity. It is used only when second_sim is set to 'jaro_winkler'.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments. They may override preceding default values.

Return type

Callable[[List[str], List[str]], float]

Returns

A soft-tfidf similarity function. It accepts two tokenized strings as inputs and returns a float as their similarity score weighted by the given weight.

class entity_resolver.core.utils.SimilarityEntry(cluster1, cluster2, similarity)[source]¶

Bases: object

Stores information about two clusters and their similarity.

Comparisons between SimilarityEntry objects are achieved by implementing all comparison magical methods. This helps with implementation of the PriorityQueue object. Since the PriorityQueue class is implmented as a min heap while the clustering algorithm needs to pop out the entry with the largest similarity first, the comparison operators are implemented as the reverse of the similarities comparisons.

Parameters

  • cluster1 (Any) – One of the two clusters between which the similarity is computed.

  • cluster2 (Any) – One of the two clusters between which the similarity is computed.

  • similarity (float) – The similarity between cluster1 and cluster2.

clusters[source]¶

The tuple (cluster1, cluster2) initialized during object instantiation.

Type

Tuple[Any, Any]

similarity[source]¶

Same as in the parameters section.

Type

float

index[source]¶

Store the index of the entry in the PriorityQueue object. Used to implement its update and remove methods. It is set to -1 if not contained in the priority queue.

Type

int

class entity_resolver.core.utils.WithLogger(verbose=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class with a pre-configured logger attribute.

This class is created as a parent class for any class that needs a built-in logger. The logger is pre-configured so that each of the class will have a uniform logging style.

Parameters

verbose (int) – Indicate how much information to be logged/printed in the console during the program execution. It is the same as verbose attribute of EntityResolver.

_verbose[source]¶

Same as in the parameters section.

Type

int

_logger[source]¶

Encapsulated by the logger property for read-only. They are essentially the same.

Type

Logger

_config_logger()[source]¶

A helper method to initialize logger configuration.

Return type

None

_get_level()[source]¶

Convert verbose to logging level

Return type

int

Returns

  • If verbose <= 0, then return logging.WARNING.

  • If verbose == 1, then return logging.INFO.

  • If verbose >= 2, then return logging.DEBUG.

_set_verbose(value)[source]¶

Remained empty for child classes to extend the verbose setter.

Parameters

value – The verbose value to be set to.

property logger[source]¶

Logger: Configured according to the verbose attribute. Ready-only.

property verbose[source]¶

Same as the verbose argument in the parameters section.

class entity_resolver.core.utils.logtime(header)[source]¶

Bases: object

A decorator factory for wrapping (class) methods to log time taken.

Parameters

header (str) – The prefix string attached before the time in the log output. Eg., if header is set to 'time taken', then the log for a function that takes 1s will be 'time taken: 1s'. The colon and ‘s’ are always added.

Important

The class or object of the decorated method must have the logger attribute of type Logger.

Note

The logged time taken is always rounded up to two decimal places.

header[source]¶

Same as in the parameters section.

Type

str

__call__(func)[source]¶

Decorate the input (class) method.

Parameters

func (Callable) – The method or class method to be decorated.

Return type

Callable

Returns

A wrapper method that will log the time taken for the input method after it finishes.

_timed_func(func, obj, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Execute input (class) method and log its time taken.

This helper method is used by __call__ to create the wrapper method, since fixing the func parameter of this method with the decorated method will just results in a desired wrapper.

Parameters

  • func (Callable) – The method to be executed, whose time taken will also be logged.

  • obj (Any) – The class or object that the input method is attached to.

Return type

Any

Returns

The same return as that of the func argument.

class entity_resolver.core.utils.subparser(subcommand, subcommand_help, *helps)[source]¶

Bases: object

A decorator factory for wrapping a function with a subparser adder.

Parameters

  • subcommand (str) – Name of the subcommand to be added.

  • subcommand_help (str) – Helper string to explain functionality of the subcommand tool to be added.

  • *helps – Helper strings that will be associated in the subcommand tool with each keyword argument of the decorated function in the order of their appearances in the function declaration.

subcommand[source]¶

Same as in the parameters section.

Type

str

subcommand_help[source]¶

Same as in the parameters section.

Type

str

helps[source]¶

Same as in the parameters section.

Type

Iterable[str]

__call__(func)[source]¶

Decorate the input function.

Parameters

func (Callable) – This function should only take keyword arguments. It is the function to be wrapped into a subcommand tool.

Return type

Callable

Returns

The returned function takes exactly one special object that is returned by add_subparsers and add a subparser which performs the same task as the decorated function with help strings specified in the object attributes.

The keyword arguments of the original function correspond to optional command line flags with names prefixed by ‘–’, and their default values are used as default values of the optional flags as well.

Eg., the function f(x=1) will results in an optional command line argument '--x' with default value 1.

_create_subparser(func, subparsers)[source]¶

A subparser adder function that wraps the input function.

This helper method implements a subparser adder function given an input function. The core __call__ method uses this function by creating a functools.partial object that fixes the func argument with the function to be decorated, which is then returned as the desired wrapper.

Parameters

  • func (Callable) – The function to be wrapped.

  • subparsers (Action) – A special action object in the argparse module that has a single add_parser method.

Return type

None

_parse_func(func)[source]¶

Extract information about the input function’s keyword arguments.

Parameters

func (Callable) – This function’s keyword arguments information is to be extracted and returned.

Return type

List[Tuple[str, Any, str]]

Returns

Each item in the returned list is a tuple stroing the information about the input function’s keyword arguments and the help string corresponding to the arguments:

(<keyword name>, <default value>, <help string>)

_parser_function(func, func_info, args)[source]¶

Take arguments from args and feed into the input function.

This helper method implements how the input function should parse and take arguments from a Namespace object based on the keyword arguments information of this function. Similar to _create_parse, it is also used as a partial object with fixed func and func_info, which is then stored in the func namespace of the subparser and called after parsing command line arguments.

Parameters

  • func (Callable) – The function to be wrapped.

  • func_info (List[Tuple[str, Any, str]]) – The keyword arguments information of the func argument. It is the returned value of _parse_func method.

  • args (Namespace) – The namespace that the wrapper function should take arguments from.

Return type

Any

Returns

The same return as that of the func argument.

entity_resolver.core.utils.timeit(func)[source]¶

A decroator to register time spent by a (class) method.

Parameters

func (Callable) – A method or a class method to be decorated.

Important

The class or object that the decorated (class) method is attached to must have a time_dict attribute of type: defaultdict. It should be instantiated using equivalent of the follow:

>>> collections.defaultdict(lambda: [0, 0])

This dictionary maps method names to a list of two entries:

[<number of times called>, <total time spent by all calls>].

Return type

Callable

Returns

A wrapper of the decorated function which alters the time_dict attribute of the class or object the decorated function is attached to by incrementing the number of times called by one, and the total time spent by the time taken for this method call.
